free_text.Form of examination: With continuous control : homework, tests and exam during the 14 weeks semester and one written final exam during the exam session.
free_text.Bibliography and material: Literature and pointers will be given in class
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic algebra is helpful but not required
free_text.Content: An incomplete list of subjects that may be discussed : modular (and Montgomery) arthmetic, finite field representations, elliptic curves, smoothness, polynomial and integer factorization methods, discrete logarithm methods, primality testing, lattice basis reduction.
free_text.Learning outcomes: This course consists of a detailed presentation of the most important computational methods that are used in public key cryptography and cryptanalysis

en.title: Algorithms in public-key cryptology
en.library_recommends: • "A computational introduction to number theory and algebra / Victor Shoup". Year:2005. ISBN:978-0-521-61725-3

free_text.Remarque: Written final exam only for students who failed to pass their homeworks assignements
free_text.Prérequis: Algèbre de base (recommandé, mais non requis)
free_text.Bibliographie et matériel: A computational introduction to number theory and algebra, by Victor Shoup, as available on http://www.shoup.net/ntb
free_text.Contenu: Une liste non exhaustive des points abordés :[br/]Arithmétique modulaire et de Montgomery, arithmétique et représentation des corps finis, courbes elliptiques, friabilité, factorisation d'entiers et de polynômes, méthodes pour le logarithme discret, tests de primalité, réduction de réseau.
free_text.Forme du contrôle: Avec contrôle continu : devoir maison, tests et examen au cours des 14 semaines du semestre, plus un examen final écrit pendant la session d'examen.
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: Ce cours donne une présentation détaillée des plus importants algorithmes et méthodes de calcul, qui sont utilisés en cryptographie et en cryptanalyse à clé publique.

fr.title: Algorithms in public-key cryptology
fr.library_recommends: • "A computational introduction to number theory and algebra / Victor Shoup". Année:2005. ISBN:978-0-521-61725-3
